--- title: "" --- ![](../images/horst/git-hug.png) ::: {.figLab} [Artwork by @allison_horst](https://twitter.com/allison_horst) ::: Thank you for enrolling in the **Reproducible Data Visualisation with R workshop** To get the most out of the workshop, please run through the checklist below and make sure you have all the necessary software installed. If you are already working with git in RStudio you may be ready to go. If you are just getting started, keep in mind that these configuration steps can be half the battle. Don't worry if you get stuck, we are here to help.

::: {.callout-tip} ## Configuring Git, GitHub and RStudio Configuring Git, GitHub and RStudio to work together is half the battle when it comes to using Git in RStudio. Luckily there is an excellent online reference for this: [Happy Git and GitHub for the useR](https://happygitwithr.com/) by Jennifer Bryan. The chapters linked below refer to key sections in this book. We won't have time to configure everybody's laptop at the workshop so please work through these steps in advance! :::
**Checklist:** * A laptop (and a charger!) * At least a basic working knowledge of R and RStudio. If you are a beginner, check out the one-hour webinar [A gengle introduction to tidy statistics in R](https://posit.co/resources/videos/a-gentle-introduction-to-tidy-statistics-in-r/){target="_blank"}) * A free GitHub user account. See [Ch 4. Register a GitHub account](https://happygitwithr.com/github-acct#github-acct) * A recent version of R (at least v4.3.0) and RStudio (at least a 2024 version) installed on your laptop. See [Ch 5. Install or upgrade R and RStudio](https://happygitwithr.com/install-r-rstudio){target="_blank"} * Git installed on your laptop. See [Ch 6. Install Git](https://happygitwithr.com/install-git){target="_blank"} * Configure Git, GitHub and RStudio. See [Ch 9. Personal access token for HTTPS](https://happygitwithr.com/https-pat) and especially [Section 9.1 TL;DR](https://happygitwithr.com/https-pat#tldr)

::: {.callout-warning} ## Git Credentials Follow [Section 9.1 TL;DR](https://happygitwithr.com/https-pat#tldr) from Happy Git and GitHub for the useR to set up your Git Credentials. Note these steps can be completed in RStudio by calling the following commands ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} usethis::create_github_token() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gitcreds::gitcreds_set() ``` ::: To run these commands you may need to install the `usethis` and `gitcreds` packages if they are not installed already. Copy and paste the following commands into the RStudio console: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages("usethis") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages("gitcreds") ``` ::: :::
